definition: to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.chinese: 第三点，短跑强调摆臂动作。

sentences.english: But in the 100-meter dash, Wilma Rudolph won.
sentences.chinese: 但在一百米短跑中，威尔玛鲁道夫却赢了。

sentences.english: Track and field sprint is a typical speed of the physical class-based project.
sentences.chinese: 田径短跑运动是典型的体能类速度型项目。

sentences.english: He ran 18 marathons before dropping to shorter distances.
sentences.chinese: 他赛了18次马拉松后才改短跑的。

sentences.english: He has broken all records in the l00 meter dash.
sentences.chinese: 他打破了一百米短跑的纪录。

sentences.english: Joe beat out last year's champion in the 100-meter sprint by one second.
sentences.chinese: 乔在百米短跑赛中以一秒之差打败去年冠军。

sentences.english: On the flat, there are sprints, middle distance races and long distance races.
sentences.chinese: 平跑项目有短跑，中距离和长距离。

sentences.english: This results prompt that to develop the speed of sprint attention should be paid to hip-joint extension.
sentences.chinese: 这一研究成果提示我们，发展短跑速度应从髋部做起。

sentences.english: She set a new world record in the 200-meter dash.
sentences.chinese: 她创造了二百米短跑新世界记录。

sentences.english: He is more a sprinter than a swimmer.
sentences.chinese: 他是短跑健将，而不怎么游泳选手。

sentences.english: The extensor muscle strength of shoulder joint is more influencing than the flexor muscle strength of shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 肩关节伸肌群力量较屈肌群力量对短跑成绩影响大。

sentences.english: One study of elite sprinters found that 95% of them had this gene variant.
sentences.chinese: 一项研究发现95%优秀的短跑选手身上有这种基因。

sentences.english: Wind sprints are an anaerobic exercise.
sentences.chinese: 极速短跑是一种无氧运动。

sentences.english: He looked like an Olympic sprinter.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去就像一个奥运会的短跑选手。

sentences.english: The contestants lined up for the 100-yard dash.
sentences.chinese: 参赛选手列队参加100码短跑。

sentences.english: Many young entrepreneurs think startups are like sprints, when you just race from the start to the finish line.
sentences.chinese: 许多年轻企业家认为创业就像短跑，从起点冲到终点。
